snippet: The company has invited reporters to the Guggenheim Museum for "an education announcement" next week.
abstract: The company has invited reporters to the Guggenheim Museum for "an education announcement" next week.
lead_paragraph: Apple will begin a new push in the digital textbook business, Bits blog is reporting, inviting journalists next week to the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum in New York "for an education announcement in the Big Apple." The event will not feature any new devices, according to a person briefed on the event, but follows comments Steve Jobs made to his biographer, Walter Isaacson, about wanting to transform the textbook market by hiring prominent writers to create electronic textbooks for the iPad. Read more on Bits blog »

headline.main: Apple Takes Aim at the Textbook Market
